result.execSummary:
The defendant James F. Sorensen III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James F. Sorensen III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James F. Sorensen III was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED  -  $17 WFDA was omitted
Deft called to set up payment plan.  Case has not been closed out yet.  Informed him to call back next week.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Attorney A Komp appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Komp waives deft's appearance. Court notes that the deft plead to an amended information which was never filed, case is concluded with exception of the amended information being filed. State files an amended information. Atty Komp acknowedges receipt and waives reading; states that the deft was aware of this and plead to the amended charge. Court accepts filing of amended information; case is concluded.
With ADA Drees and Atty Komp a hearing is set for 10/18/18 at 8:45am so that the State can file an amended information and Atty Komp can acknowledge receipt; the deft does not need to appear.
$275.60  Failure to pay, civil judgment.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp. Clerk/H. Barnett. On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed. Deft pleads guilty. Court finds deft guilty. Court imposes $10 fine plus costs, 30 DTP or civil judgment.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp. Clerk/H. Barnett. ADA Drees reports that the deft is down to $200 owed on restitution. PLEAS set for 9/27/18 at 1:15pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Parties have reached a resolution and have agreed to restitution amount of $6,600.00.  FPT 11/3/16 at 10:30 with 16CF712.  Bond continued.
from Ronald R.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim's present.  Atty Komp states she needs time to discuss case w/ADA Drees.  FPT continued to 10/13/16 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.

With Atty Komp and by agreement of ADA Drees the FPT of 8/11/16 at 10:30am is rescheduled, as Atty German is on the deft's newer file and is not available and wants time to review discovery and pursue a global offer; reset to 9/1/16 at 1:15pm.

Minutes:  Branch 3 acting for Branch 6.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Angela Komp.  Subst. previously filed on Judge Schroeder.  Atty Komp reports the deft is requesting more time to pay restitution.  In addition, State reports the deft has new charges pending.  Status set for 8/11/16 @ 10:30am

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  Atty Komp states the case is resolved, deft is going to pay up front restitution, has paid $1,000 today.  ADA McNeill states she is releasing a piece of evidence to one of the victims.  Atty Komp agrees.  STC set for 7/20/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
